properties.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 19 at 11:37AM MST until February 20 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW OVER PORTIONS OF FAR NORTHEAST NEW
MEXICO TONIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY MORNING...

.As a disturbance makes its way over the central Rockies, periods
of light snow will continue over the northern mountains of New
Mexico tonight and early Thursday morning. A potent backdoor cold
front will invade northeastern New Mexico this evening, leading to
increased snowfall through the overnight hours from the northern
Sangre De Cristos through Union County. Snow will then decrease in
coverage and intensity through the late morning Thursday.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of generally 3 to
5 inches.

* WHERE...Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Johnson and
Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass.

* WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on icy and snow packed road conditions and
reduced visibility in snow.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY
